spy4cast.stypes module#

class spy4cast.stypes.Slise(lat0: Union[float, int], latf: Union[float, int], lon0: Union[float, int], lonf: Union[float, int], month0: Union[spy4cast.stypes.Month, int], monthf: Union[spy4cast.stypes.Month, int], year0: int, yearf: int, sy: Optional[int] = None)#

Bases: object

Dataclass to create a Slise

A slise is the way of slicing datasets that is convenient to the user and the API

Note

The developers of this API are aware that the correct slpelling for slice is with a c. However, slice is a built-in function in python and in the start of the development of this poject was better to use slise. This is the reason why this class is spelled with s (it wouldn’t conflict with slice right now because it is capitalised, but it is kinda cool, right?)

lat0: Union[float, int]#

Minimum latitude

latf: Union[float, int]#

Maximum latitude

lon0: Union[float, int]#

Minimum longitud

lonf: Union[float, int]#

Maximum longitud

month0: Union[spy4cast.stypes.Month, int]#

Starting month of the season to select (included)

monthf: Union[spy4cast.stypes.Month, int]#

Ending month of the season to select (included)

year0: int#

Starting year of the period to select (included)

yearf: int#

Ending year of the period to select (included)

sy: Optional[int] = None#

“(optional) Selected year used in methodologies like anom where you can only plot a given year

classmethod default(month0: int = Month.JAN, monthf: int = Month.DEC, year0: int = 0, yearf: int = 2000, sy: Optional[int] = None) → spy4cast.stypes.Slise#

Alternartive constructor that creates a Slise that has the largest spatial region and season possible

It is useful if you want to create fast a Slise where you conly want to modify the initial and final year for example

Return type

Slise(-90, 90, -180, 180, month0, monthf, year0, yearf, sy)

alias of Tuple[float, float, float]

spy4cast.stypes.T_FORMAT = '%d/%m/%Y %H:%M:%S'#

Time stamp format used internally

spy4cast.stypes.TimeStamp#

TimeStamp type. Union of standard library datetime.datetime and pandas.Timestamp

alias of Union[pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp, datetime.datetime]

enum spy4cast.stypes.Month(value)#

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Enumaration for Months.

Useful to use together with Slise

Example

>>> Slise(-20, 20, -100, -60, Month.DEC, Month.FEB, 1870, 1910)
Member Type

int

Valid values are as follows:

JAN = <Month.JAN: 1>#
FEB = <Month.FEB: 2>#
MAR = <Month.MAR: 3>#
APR = <Month.APR: 4>#
MAY = <Month.MAY: 5>#
JUN = <Month.JUN: 6>#
JUL = <Month.JUL: 7>#
AUG = <Month.AUG: 8>#
SEP = <Month.SEP: 9>#
OCT = <Month.OCT: 10>#
NOV = <Month.NOV: 11>#
DEC = <Month.DEC: 12>#
flag spy4cast.stypes.F(value)#

Bases: enum.IntFlag

An enumeration.

Member Type

int

Valid values are as follows:

SAVE_DATA = <F.SAVE_DATA: 1>#

Save data. Check documentation for each specific function you pass this flag into

SAVE_FIG = <F.SAVE_FIG: 2>#

Save fig (calls matplotlib.pyplot.Figure.savefig)

SILENT_ERRORS = <F.SILENT_ERRORS: 4>#

If an exception is raise in Plotter.run, the program won`t be halted

SHOW_PLOT = <F.SHOW_PLOT: 8>#

Shows the figure (calls matplotlib.pyplot.Figure.show() and matplotlib.pyplot.show if NOT_HALT is not set)

FILTER = <F.FILTER: 16>#

Perform butterworth filter in preprocesseing. Only for spy4caster.Spy4Caster

NOT_HALT = <F.NOT_HALT: 32>#

Not halt the program after showing (don’t run matplotlib.pyplot.show)

class spy4cast.stypes.RDArgs(dataset_dir: Optional[str] = None, dataset_name: Optional[str] = None, variable: Optional[str] = None, chunks: Optional[Union[int, Tuple[int, ...], Tuple[Tuple[int, ...], ...], Dict[Union[str, int], int]]] = None)#

Bases: object

Dataclass to convientely pass arguements for a ReadData constructor

It is mainly used with spy4cast.Spy4Caster when you create to ReadData objects

class spy4cast.stypes.RDArgsDict#

Bases: dict

Typed dict to set as as a type and indicate the arguments that should be passes into read_data.ReadData

It is used mainly as an alternative to RDArgs
